by B_Radley

Why are we here? Why do we do what we do? Why do we keep fighting? Two Queens learn from a mother and a father of choice and of blood.

blog.name: mandowords
blog.title: Miit'alor
blog.description: I am a descriptivist linguist for the Mando'a language. I show what it can do, not what it MUST do. This is a place for discussion about Mando'a, and Mandalorian society and culture. Feel free to use the head cannons from this blog (or reblogged from others) in your RP or writing. All words and descriptions are taken from the mandoa.org Mandalorian Dictionary. Want to support this blog? Buy me a Kofi? OR buy some Mando'a themed items? Visit our Discord? Blog icon by Rina

blog.name: unspeakablehorror
blog.title: Loftwings and Demons
blog.description:
I post about Legend of Zelda and Star Wars. Especially Skyward Sword and my rather longish fanfic Ascent (on fanfiction.net and AO3). I am a fanatical Ghirahim fan, in case you hadn't noticed. My favorite Star Wars villain is General Grievous, and my Cut Strings fanfic features him as a central character.


I'll probably also have posts on writing and random posts on things that that I find interesting or important. Please feel free to send me notes if you want to talk!


This blog is rated PG-13 (or as close to that as you're likely to find on Tumblr, anyway). Is that SFW? That depends on the number of below-13 people hanging out at your workplace, I imagine.


Rabbits.


ETA Dec 23,2018: Had to make some changes to my blog theme for SSL compatibility reasons.

blog.name: johnnyclash87
blog.title: Fandoms Books Social Consciousness
blog.description:
I'll come up with a better title eventually.

Short and sweet I'm a nerd/geek. I listen to punk. I'm a feminist. I'm an lgbtq ally. I'm a wanna be superhero/adventurer. Because I talk a lot about race and racism I should probably clarify that I’m white and male.?

One of the things I love is how speculative fiction can be used to talk about serious topics. Which is what this will mostly be about. Along with just some fun things.

body:
I’m just saying..

Before he was sent to jail, Boba Fett was clearly remorseful of his actions and had shown signs of empathy and compassion… so maybe if he had gotten some help dealing with his fathers death , instead of being put with grown ass murderers and criminals.. he might have grown to be a relatively decent person.

summary:
I'm literally only going to watch Solo so I can be up to date enough to properly write Lando/Boba nonsense.
The Lando...
body:
I’m literally only going to watch Solo so I can be up to date enough to properly write Lando/Boba nonsense.

The Lando Calrissian/Boba Fett ship name should be Loba because that’s badass, so that’s what I’m calling them.

Stan a rare pair queen!

blog.name: star-wars-ao3-fandom-stats
blog.title: Star Wars Pairings on AO3 Fandom Stats
blog.description: 1. I list all Star Wars ships with at least 100 fanworks. 2. Sometimes I'm making lists with the Sequel Trilogy ships with less than 100, but more than 19 fanworks.  3. I don’t include reader-inserts and ships involving OCs (unless I'm making a list of ships with one specific character).

summary: TBH, I feel like Anakin and Vader are distinct enough characters /in canon/ to make Padem/Anakin and Padem/Vader two distinct...
question: TBH, I feel like Anakin and Vader are distinct enough characters /in canon/ to make Padem/Anakin and Padem/Vader two distinct ships. (With Kylo it's a little different because we've only ever seen him really as KYLO in canon...)
answer:
Well, we’ve seen him as Ben in his and Luke’s flashback in TLJ ;)

In case of Anakin/Vader: well, even LF frequently markets Anakin and Vader as if they were two completely different characters (f.e. on the official Star Wars Spotify profile). But I think that if in Obikin’s case I’m using the tag merged by AO3, I should do something similar for Anidala and other Anakin/Vader ships as well.

blog.name: swpromptsandasks
blog.title: StarWars prompts and asks
blog.description: Send me your best (weird, nsfw and cute) prompts and asks for Star wars and if they contain Obi-Wan then hurray for me. Lets see what we can drum up. (I don't write for the last trilogy, apologies)

summary: Mynameis, what comes now? How is Obi-Wan adjusting to life in the past?
question: Mynameis, what comes now? How is Obi-Wan adjusting to life in the past?
answer:
Curling into the other man, Obi-Wan watched the glowing lights around them with a curious little smile as they flashed in the colors of the rainbow and paired up, the gem like fireflies beautiful as they blinked with lights of all colors to attract a mate.

As far as he understood, the light show didn’t really mean so much but the pheromones the bugs released did. That was also what changed the color as with every burst of them the body light up anew.

They were utterly gorgeous and the fact that Obi-Wan got to enjoy them with Qui-Gon was an experience he wouldn’t trade for anything as he curled even more against the others side with the thick arm curled around his waist.

Its been so odd, settling into this time, there are things Obi-Wan remembers are coming that he’s warned his master about as Yoda listens with an open mind and heart even if he doesn’t quite want to believe.

Yet he knows that Obi-Wan is not lying.

So he listens and finds a way to tell the other on the council without revealing his source.

And Obi-Wan continues to go on missions with other Jedi, mostly Qui-Gon and Master Dooku but he has also left the temple with Knight Tholme and Master Plo at several points. But his missions are usually set with Qui-Gon since they are life bonded and too long a true separation would damage them, especially when the bond was still not older than two years.

For this mission he’s grateful he is with Qui-Gon however as the Jedi oversee a wedding of the Emperor’s daughter and heir to the son of one of the lesser hive minded sons of their neighbors.

He’s not sure how the relationship will work out between the insectoids who spend mostly time under the ground and a human but well, life always found a way and they did not seem opposed to each other by the way they sat close with their heads bent together, whispering to each other while the insectoids gem like wings buzz with excitement or maybe happiness as they sit together on the grass not that far from Obi-Wan and Qui-Gon actually.

Bipedal insects with exoskeleton and bipedal mammal… well maybe they’ll adopt heirs or something.

“You’re thinking too hard.” Qui-Gon noted teasingly.

“I can’t help it, its a strange pairing but I’m not here to judge.” Obi-Wan chuckled, pressing closer to Qui-Gon’s side as they sat on the grass and enjoyed the moonlight. “They look pretty happy actually.” He noted with a small smile. Not every arranged marriage had a happy beginning, middle or end but sometimes…

Sometimes people turned lucky.

Qui-Gon let out a small hum at that, nuzzling at Obi-Wan’s hair. “Well, you got a point there. They do look happy, sometimes you have to take what you get.” He noted with quiet warmth and love before pulling his somewhat smaller bonded into his lap with a grin. “Now, do you want to tell me what has Yan up in arms? He came from a meeting with Master Yoda looking like someone had pooped in his teabox.” Qui-Gon teased lightly and if t wasn’t for the down turned corners of his lip, you’d believe he only meant it as a tease.

“…I believe Master Yoda shared some rather horrible news of the future with Master Yan.” Obi-Wan confessed softly, rubbing his cheek against the others to feel the light scruff and sighing slightly. “Stuff I’m not at liberty to share with you just yet.” Obi-Wan said.

Nodding at that, Qui-Gon pressed a kiss to the others nose. “I’ll guess I’ll learn eventually.”

Pressing closer, Obi-Wan thought of yellow eyes and darkness. “…I think you will yes.” The redhead agreed ominously before smiling meekly and looking around. “But for now its a wedding with fireflies that changes colors and happiness in the air as insectoids create music with their wings. Let us enjoy it while it lasts my dear Qui-Gon.” He settled into him.

Thick arms tightened around him, Qui-Gon’s strong muscles providing warmth and protection. “That sounds like a wonderful idea Obi-Wan.” He agreed, both turning back to the display of fireflies that was part of the wedding ritual, the moon shining bright above them as the only other light outside of the fireflies.

reblog.comment:
Curling into the other man, Obi-Wan watched the glowing lights around them with a curious little smile as they flashed in the colors of the rainbow and paired up, the gem like fireflies beautiful as they blinked with lights of all colors to attract a mate.

As far as he understood, the light show didn’t really mean so much but the pheromones the bugs released did. That was also what changed the color as with every burst of them the body light up anew.

They were utterly gorgeous and the fact that Obi-Wan got to enjoy them with Qui-Gon was an experience he wouldn’t trade for anything as he curled even more against the others side with the thick arm curled around his waist.

Its been so odd, settling into this time, there are things Obi-Wan remembers are coming that he’s warned his master about as Yoda listens with an open mind and heart even if he doesn’t quite want to believe.

Yet he knows that Obi-Wan is not lying.

So he listens and finds a way to tell the other on the council without revealing his source.

And Obi-Wan continues to go on missions with other Jedi, mostly Qui-Gon and Master Dooku but he has also left the temple with Knight Tholme and Master Plo at several points. But his missions are usually set with Qui-Gon since they are life bonded and too long a true separation would damage them, especially when the bond was still not older than two years.

For this mission he’s grateful he is with Qui-Gon however as the Jedi oversee a wedding of the Emperor’s daughter and heir to the son of one of the lesser hive minded sons of their neighbors.

He’s not sure how the relationship will work out between the insectoids who spend mostly time under the ground and a human but well, life always found a way and they did not seem opposed to each other by the way they sat close with their heads bent together, whispering to each other while the insectoids gem like wings buzz with excitement or maybe happiness as they sit together on the grass not that far from Obi-Wan and Qui-Gon actually.

Bipedal insects with exoskeleton and bipedal mammal… well maybe they’ll adopt heirs or something.

“You’re thinking too hard.” Qui-Gon noted teasingly.

“I can’t help it, its a strange pairing but I’m not here to judge.” Obi-Wan chuckled, pressing closer to Qui-Gon’s side as they sat on the grass and enjoyed the moonlight. “They look pretty happy actually.” He noted with a small smile. Not every arranged marriage had a happy beginning, middle or end but sometimes…

Sometimes people turned lucky.

Qui-Gon let out a small hum at that, nuzzling at Obi-Wan’s hair. “Well, you got a point there. They do look happy, sometimes you have to take what you get.” He noted with quiet warmth and love before pulling his somewhat smaller bonded into his lap with a grin. “Now, do you want to tell me what has Yan up in arms? He came from a meeting with Master Yoda looking like someone had pooped in his teabox.” Qui-Gon teased lightly and if t wasn’t for the down turned corners of his lip, you’d believe he only meant it as a tease.

“…I believe Master Yoda shared some rather horrible news of the future with Master Yan.” Obi-Wan confessed softly, rubbing his cheek against the others to feel the light scruff and sighing slightly. “Stuff I’m not at liberty to share with you just yet.” Obi-Wan said.

Nodding at that, Qui-Gon pressed a kiss to the others nose. “I’ll guess I’ll learn eventually.”

Pressing closer, Obi-Wan thought of yellow eyes and darkness. “…I think you will yes.” The redhead agreed ominously before smiling meekly and looking around. “But for now its a wedding with fireflies that changes colors and happiness in the air as insectoids create music with their wings. Let us enjoy it while it lasts my dear Qui-Gon.” He settled into him.

Thick arms tightened around him, Qui-Gon’s strong muscles providing warmth and protection. “That sounds like a wonderful idea Obi-Wan.” He agreed, both turning back to the display of fireflies that was part of the wedding ritual, the moon shining bright above them as the only other light outside of the fireflies.
